intro: Restio femineus, commonly known as the female restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale blue flowers. Restio femineus typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and is often found in coastal vegetation communities.
